issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents() as returning void (+getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): void, problem_statement.md lines 70-71), but the textual task description (problem_statement.md lines 43-45) specifies that it should return a String of the format "LectureName (TotalNumberOfStudents)", and the solution implementation returns a String (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java lines 80-82). This discrepancy between UML and the textual description/solution can confuse students about the correct return type and lead them to implement the wrong signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the UML signature in problem_statement.md to match the textual description and the solution: change the method declaration from +getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): void to +getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): String. This will make the intended return type explicit and consistent across problem statement, template guidance, and solution.
